content: It is not necessary. You would get the newest features, as TB would update every six weeks or so. You'll still get security updates and bug fixes if you don't update. One reason not to update is that some add-ons may not work until they are updated.

content: First, please do not post questions twice, as that causes confusion and duplicate efforts. If you still have your old computer and Thunderbird is still on it , you may be able to retrieve the password. You can do that at settings>Privacy&security. Otherwise, you need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: ImportExportTool non è più sviluppato da anni, ImportExportTool NG è compatibile al momento solo fino a Thunderbird 138. ImportExportTool NG NON è sviluppato da Thunderbird ma da uno sviluppatore indipendente che segue i suoi tempi e non fornisce garanzie (ovviamente). Minacciare di cambiare client considerando che sia per Thunderbird che per ImportExportTool NG non hai pagato un centesimo lascia il tempo che trova. Non ti trattiene nessuno. Buon lavoro anche a te.
creator: @next

content:
Hallo Bert,

Het lijkt er inderdaad op dat de automatische detectie heeft vastgesteld dat de 64-bitsversie kon worden geïnstalleerd. Op zich kan dat geen kwaad, standaard wordt namelijk de installatiemap van ESR gebruikt om de profielen correct om te kunnen zetten.

Waarschijnlijk kan de gehele map met de oude installatie verwijderd worden, maar om het zeker te weten kunt u het volgende proberen:

  1. Ga naar de bovenliggende map van de oude installatiemap (C:\Program Files)
  2. Geen de oude Thunderbird-installatiemap een andere naam (b.v. ‘Mozilla Thunderbird_OUD’)
  3. Start Thunderbird

Als Thunderbird normaal start en werkt, worden er geen bestanden uit de oude installatie gebruikt en kan de nu hernoemde map gerust worden verwijderd. Werkt Thunderbird niet goed, hernoem deze map dan weer naar de oude naam. Het is daarna wel zaak om uit te zoeken welke bestanden in die map nog gebruikt worden en deze op de juiste manier over te zetten.
creator: markh2

content: If you have settings for autoupdate set, you will receive updates with no further action. That is the default. You can check that at Settings>general and the Updates section. If you were on 138, you should now be on 139. If you were on 128.10, you should now be on 128.11.
creator: davidsk

content: Please clarify. Are you stating that messages sent from two other PCs and an Iphone do not appear in your sent folder? That could happen if one or more of the devices store sent messages locally. If the other devices all show sent messages done by the others, but none show sent messages from your PC, then your PC is storing messages locally or not at all. Check the copies&folders section of the account. I also suggest sending a test message from one of the other devices and verify which devices see the sent message.
creator: davidsk

content: The challenge is to get Bitdefender to work with thunderbird, not thunderbird to work with Bitdefender. See if there are settings to bypass email interference. VPNs are notorious for interfering with email.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, the change is that a new monthly version is available, but only if the user requests it. The monthly version will have the latest changes and be updated more frequently. The existing extended support release (ESR) version will continue. More information is at 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel   If you are content with what you have, there is no need to take action.
creator: davidsk
